column1: The price of freedom is not free but rather is paid by the brave men & women who defend our country & the sacred ideals we cherish. I’m eternally grateful to those who have proudly served in our nation’s Military & I will never stop working to honor their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/tRxk00fpYK

Now more than ever it is important for us to remember that we are all Americans.  We must continue to work together to find common ground and chart a course that restores our way of life rebuilds our economy and renews the American dream.

I am proud to live in a nation where civil discourse is encouraged.  It has been a challenging year with people on all sides of the political spectrum vigorously advocating for their vision of how we can best solve our nation’s challenges.

Serving as your voice in Washington D.C. is one of the greatest honors of my life.  Thank you for giving me the privilege of representing you for another term.  You have my solemn commitment that I will do everything in my power to fight for you and our community.

Proud to hear @SecPompeo say what I've known for a long time: that Greece is a pillar for stability & prosperity in the Eastern Mediterranean. The Secretary's deep concern over Turkey's intransigence & U.S. actions to bolster Greece are reshaping the region in a meaningful way.

Tampa Bay! Celebrate like it's 2004 and enjoy that socially distant parade today! Our @TBLightning are Champions again! I made sure to bring the #Thunder on the House Floor this morning for @RealStamkos91 & #VictorHedman! #GoBolts #BeTheThunder  https://t.co/Uso31YEY88

Don’t Forget! This afternoon at 4:30 I will be going live on #Facebook with @DrPhilRoe to discuss #OperationWarpSpeed. You can submit questions on Facebook for an opportunity to have it answered live.
@paradigmshift05 Sorry about that. All of the information is in a chain directly beneath this tweet. If you go to my profile you will be able to see.
@Tarpon_Gator Sorry about that. All of the information is in a chain directly beneath this tweet.
Today several bipartisan bills that I sponsored were debated on the House Floor and passed through a suspension of the rules. See below to learn more about these important pieces of legislation.
In 2016 an estimated 11% of all ER patients displayed suicidal ideation but only 3% were identified and linked with treatment. Thanks to @ENAorg for bringing this problem to my attention.
The Effective Screening Suicide Screening & Assessment in the Emergency Department Act creates a uniform screening tool to assess patients in the ER for suicide risk.

An impressive 22 therapies have been approved since the PRV’s inception in 2012. Pediatric cancer remains the #1 cause of death in American children with thousands of children lost to cancer each year. We can do better! Thanks to @EveryLifeOrg & @KIDSvCANCER for the support!

The Creating Hope Reauthorization Act reauthorizes the #PriorityReviewVoucher (PRV) program for rare pediatric diseases for four more years. PRV incentivizes the development of cures for childhood cancer.

The STAND-UP Act has a goal to identify threats before they materialize & ensure at-risk students get the mental health treatment they need. These programs reduce bullying suicide & campus violence. A special thanks to @SandyHookPromise Foundation for its support.

Big Announcement!   For tomorrow’s #FacebookLive I will be joined by the Co-Chair of the #GOPDoctorsCaucus @DrPhilRoe! He will be providing us with an update and taking your medical related questions. You won’t want to miss this one!

While one Tampa Bay championship run comes to an end another begins! Best of luck to our American League Best @RaysBaseball as they begin their quest to secure their first #WorldSeries title! Let's make Tampa Bay #TitleTownUSA! https://t.co/ZaRdjQ3Gbt

Tomorrow at 4:30pm I will be going live on #Facebook to discuss #OperationWarpSpeed and the continued push to find a safe and effective vaccine to combat #COVID19. Check back later for the announcement on my special guest.

As a member of @HouseCommerce I'm proud to cosponsor the Nuclear Energy Leadership Act. This bill asks @SecBrouillette to establish advanced nuclear goals. As we continue to expand renewable energy sources I am hopeful we will take a serious look at nuclear energy. #NCEW20
Fast Fact: Before #COVID19 there were 12202 solar energy jobs in Florida. It is time to get these folks back to work. #NCEW20
During this #NCEW20 I want to hear from you! What are your thoughts on renewable energy? Comment below.

Did you know that solar energy not only helps our environment but also boosts our economy? We need to do more during this #NCEW20 and every week to expand our use of clean energy sources. https://t.co/EYoQpxn5uU

@NCTAitv & @EdSuperHighway announced the launch of K-12 Bridge to Broadband a groundbreaking public-private initiative that connects students from low-income families to the internet for remote & hybrid learning. This is a great partnership for our children & their education.

American values and national interests are advanced through a stronger bilateral relationship with #Cyprus. Today I am thrilled that @SecPompeo exercised the provisions of the #EastMedAct - which I coauthored - to lift the arms embargo on Cyprus and allow non-lethal aid.

@Craig37803029 Hi Craig. Simply send us an email requesting assistance and we will send you a privacy release form.
The state has informed me that they will be issuing payments after July 31st for unemployment that was incurred during the eligibility period. We will continue working until this gets resolved.
Many of you have contacted my office about the expiration of unemployment benefits that will occur today. I took this concern to senior state officials.

We are also helping those in my district who have not received their stimulus check. If you or someone you know who lives in my district is still waiting on a check please send an email to FL12IRS@mail.house.gov

If you or someone you know who lives in the 12th Congressional District is still not receiving their unemployment benefits please send an email to FL12UNEMPLOYMENTHELP@mail.house.gov we will be happy to assist you.

With this week coming to a close I wanted to take a moment & thank my team. We have been working around the clock to help people who have not received their unemployment benefits. We have helped over 4000 & won’t stop until everyone is paid.

Veterans living locally may be eligible for rent and/or utility assistance through the V.A.'s Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) program. Eligibility requirements include earning less than 50% of the Average Median Income. Veterans may call 1-844-455-SSVF (7783)
This means there I still over $100 billion available in this fund.  If you are still waiting for approval please consider reapplying through a different lender. (3/3) https://t.co/EXkMcxFYy4
As of 5pm on Saturday May 16th the SBA has approved more than 2.76 million loans for small businesses for a total of over $195.17 billion during the second round of funding for PPP. (2/3)
Here is updated information for small businesses which have received a PPP loan.  It outlines the process for loan forgiveness.  I hope you find it helpful! (1/3)

Earlier today the Department of Health and Human Services announced that Florida will receive $420883713 in CARES Act funding to increase testing capacity.  More testing means improved data-driven decision making.

Today we celebrate the 75th anniversary of V-E Day which marks the defeat of the Nazi regime in WWII. The bravery and patriotism displayed by WWII Veterans reminds us that good triumphs over evil when the cause is just. We are forever grateful for their service and sacrifice. https://t.co/0PADX8m9O6

May 8th will mark the 75th Anniversary of V-E Day. The Library of Congress has released a collection of stories of Veterans who served in WWII. This is a wonderful opportunity to be reminded of the challenges and triumphs that our nation has experienced. https://t.co/x76XVEUMzT
Yesterday the Department of Treasury issued additional guidance on the program.  It may be helpful to you. (2/2) https://t.co/pht4E02frM

Every day I am receiving new reports from local small business owners who have finally received their PPP loans which is great news!  However many of these business owners have very specific questions about how the loans/loan forgiveness will work. (1/2)

(2/2)Since they have such a good track record of getting approvals for the smallest of businesses during round one of PPP we set aside $60 billion of funding just for them to distribute. Our goal is to keep as many people as possible on the payroll during this difficult time.

At 10:30 this morning banks can continue submitting Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) funding. You can have more than one application in with a lender at a time and many community banks and credit unions are processing applications for non-customers. (1/2) https://t.co/r6YKWGRmoB
